alert.note: Alert for Indian River (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 17 at 12:13AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Indian River and St. Lucie. * WHEN...Until 315 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1212 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Up to 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Pierce, Indrio, Fort Pierce Inlet, Vero Beach South, Saint Lucie Airport, Saint Lucie Village, Fort Pierce North, Queens Cove, Lakewood Park, Vero Beach Highland, South Beach, Fort Pierce South, Saint Lucie, Pepper Beach Park, Moorings Of Vero Beach, Florida Ridge, Fort Pierce Ocean Park, Floralton Beach and Surfside Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
